person.persName: Edward Henry Hobson (Green County, Kentucky, merchant, saddler, Brig. Genl)

body.p: Green County, Kentucky, merchant, saddler, and soldier. Green County, Kentucky native. Son of William and Lucy Ann Hobson. Married to Kate A. Hobson. Father of William A. Hobson, Anna Mary Hobson, A. M. Hobson, John A. Hobson, Edwena Hobson, and Bettie M. Hobson. Served as First Lieutenant of the 2nd Kentucky Volunteer Infantry in the Mexican-American War. Merchant in Green County in 1850. Director of the Greensburg Branch Bank of Kentucky in 1853, and president from 1857 to 1861. Saddler in Green County in 1860. Mustered into service as colonel of the 13th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry on January 1, 1862 to March 13, 1863. Promoted to Brigadier General in March 13, 1863. Mustered out in 1865.
